results:
Based on the search results, I found information about Polish editions of "Podróże Guliwera" (Gulliver's Travels) published by various Polish publishers including PIW, Bellona, and Nasza Księgarnia. Here's what the search revealed:

## Polish Editions of "Podróże Guliwera" by Different Publishers

### Bellona Publishing House
Bellona published "Podróże Guliwera" in 2018 with ISBN 9788311152267, featuring a hardcover binding and 384 pages. There was also an earlier Bellona edition from 2012 with ISBN 9788311123823, which was a 48-page illustrated version for children.

### Nasza Księgarnia
Nasza Księgarnia published editions of "Podróże Guliwera," including one that appears in the historical record from 1958. One used copy from Nasza Księgarnia was described as having a hardcover binding, measuring 13x25cm with 184 pages.

### PIW (Państwowy Instytut Wydawniczy)
PIW published "Podróże Guliwera" in 1956, making it one of the earlier post-war Polish editions of Swift's classic work.

### Publishing History and Translations
Polish translations of this work were done by notable translators including Maciej Słomczyński, while Jan Kott's translation was a revised version of an anonymous 1784 translation. The work has been published almost continuously since its first publication, with various Polish editions appearing from 1947 through 2012 by publishers including Iskry, Książka i Wiedza, Wydawnictwo Literackie, Dolnośląskie, Zielona Sowa, and Greg.

### Cultural Impact
The enduring popularity of Swift's work is reflected in George Orwell's statement that if only six books were to survive while all others were destroyed, "Podróże Guliwera" would certainly be among them. The book gained enormous popularity soon after its publication and has been printed almost continuously since the year of its first publication.

The search shows that "Podróże Guliwera" has had a rich publishing history in Poland across multiple decades and publishers, demonstrating its lasting appeal to Polish readers.
